title: Practice Challenge
description: Now it's your turn! Your challenge: Write code that displays your own name to the console. Replace 'Your Name Here' with your actual name (keep the quotes!).
instructions: Now it's your turn! Your challenge: Write code that displays your own name to the console. Replace 'Your Name Here' with your actual name (keep the quotes!).

testCases.description: Displays a name to the console

hints.text: Make sure to keep the quotes around your name, and don't forget the semicolon at the end!

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting the quotes: console.log(Alice); won't work because the computer thinks Alice is a variable (a 'box' we'll learn about soon), not text.
commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction: Forgetting the quotes: console.log(Alice); won't work because the computer thinks Alice is a variable (a 'box' we'll learn about soon), not text.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting the semicolon: While JavaScript is forgiving about this, it's good practice to always end statements with ;
commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction: Forgetting the semicolon: While JavaScript is forgiving about this, it's good practice to always end statements with ;
